message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The findings suggest a possible miscarriage. Expectant management is generally accepted as safe for women who are clinically stable, have a gestational sac without a visible embryo, and have no signs of an ectopic pregnancy. Methotrexate is used to treat ectopic pregnancies. Serial beta-hCG measurement is done to monitor the pregnancy and detect any complications, but it is not a treatment option. Oxytocin therapy is used to induce labor, but it is not appropriate in this case as the patient is already experiencing bleeding and cramping.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The clinical presentation is consistent with a missed miscarriage, but since the patient is worried about invasive procedures, expectant management is the most appropriate next step. It involves monitoring the patient's condition without any medical intervention until the natural miscarriage occurs. Methotrexate therapy is used to treat ectopic pregnancies, not missed miscarriages. Serial beta-hCG measurements can be used to monitor a patient's condition after a miscarriage, but they are not needed for expectant management. Oxytocin therapy is used to induce labor, but it is not appropriate in this scenario.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The transvaginal ultrasound shows an empty gestational sac and the patient is worried about invasive procedures. Therefore, the most appropriate next step in management would be expectant management, which involves monitoring without any intervention, as it allows for natural expulsion of the tissue and avoids invasive procedures. Methotrexate therapy is typically used for medically managing ectopic pregnancies. Serial beta-hCG measurement can help monitor the progression of the pregnancy but is not necessary in this situation. Oxytocin therapy is used to stimulate uterine contractions and is typically used for induction of labor, which is not necessary in this case.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and ultrasound findings suggest a missed miscarriage. Expectant management, in which the patient is monitored for spontaneous resolution of the miscarriage, is a reasonable option. Methotrexate is used to treat ectopic pregnancy. Serial beta-hCG measurement can help determine if the miscarriage is resolving, but it is not necessary at this point. Oxytocin therapy is not indicated for management of a missed miscarriage.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The empty gestational sac and presence of blood clots support a diagnosis of a miscarriage. Given that the patient is at 12 weeks of gestation and has not yet undergone invasive procedures, expectant management would be the most appropriate next step. Methotrexate therapy is used for ectopic pregnancy, and this patient does not have signs of an ectopic pregnancy. Serial beta-hCG measurement would only be useful if there was uncertainty about the diagnosis, but in this case, the ultrasound findings support a diagnosis of a miscarriage. Oxytocin therapy may be used to manage incomplete miscarriages, but based on the ultrasound findings, it is unlikely to be effective in this case.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of an open cervical os and empty gestational sac on transvaginal ultrasound suggest a miscarriage. Since the patient is worried about invasive procedures, expectant management is the most appropriate next step. Methotrexate therapy is used for ectopic pregnancy, serial beta-hCG measurement may be used to confirm the diagnosis of miscarriage but not for management, and oxytocin therapy is used for induction of labor in viable pregnancies.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest a miscarriage, and since she is already 12 weeks pregnant, expectant management is appropriate. Methotrexate therapy is used for ectopic pregnancy. Serial beta-hCG measurement would monitor the patient’s levels but would not provide any treatment. Oxytocin therapy is used for labor induction, which is not appropriate in this situation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is having a miscarriage and given that she is only 12 weeks pregnant, expectant management is the best option. Methotrexate therapy is used for ectopic pregnancy. Serial beta-hCG measurement may be used to monitor the resolution of the miscarriage, but it is not necessary at this point. Oxytocin therapy is reserved for cases of incomplete miscarriage or to manage bleeding, neither of which apply in this case.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The ultrasound shows an empty gestational sac, which is consistent with a miscarriage. The patient is worried about invasive procedures, so expectant management (watchful waiting) is appropriate in this case. Methotrexate is used for ectopic pregnancies or molar pregnancies, not for a complete miscarriage. Serial beta-hCG measurement can be used to monitor the resolution of a miscarriage but is not necessary in this case since the diagnosis has been confirmed. Oxytocin therapy is used for labor induction, which is not appropriate in this case.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient presents with symptoms of a miscarriage, with an empty gestational sac and passing of blood clots. Given the patient's reluctance to undergo invasive procedures, expectant management (also known as watchful waiting) is the most appropriate next step. This involves monitoring the patient's condition without intervening, as the body naturally expels the remaining tissue. Serial beta-hCG measurement could also be done to confirm that the pregnancy hormone levels are decreasing, but it is not necessary for management. Methotrexate therapy and oxytocin therapy are not appropriate options for management of a miscarriage.
